title: Nature's mood rings: How chameleons really change color

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary reason why chameleons change color?

options.label: A
options.text: To blend in with their environment

options.label: B
options.text: To make a statement when they feel threatened or annoyed

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: Chameleons change color due to spreading out pigments in their cells

options.label: D
options.text: Chameleons change color only in response to light

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: A single layer of salt crystals

options.label: D

options.label: C
options.text: Because it can help us learn about the natural world

title: Why does February only have 28 days?

multiple-choice.question: What was the original problem that the first king of Rome, Romulus, faced when creating a calendar?

options.text: The calendar was too long and had too many months.

options.label: B
options.text: The calendar was too short and had too few months.

options.label: C
options.text: The calendar was not accurate and the seasons were out of sync with the months.

options.label: D
options.text: The calendar was not used by the Romans at all.

multiple-choice.question: Who introduced a new calendar with 12 months, including February, which had 28 days?

options.label: A
options.text: To make the calendar longer and more complicated.

options.label: B
options.text: To make the calendar shorter and simpler.

options.label: C
options.text: To compensate for the inaccuracy of the calendar and keep the seasons in sync with the months.

options.label: C
options.text: The calendar was prone to errors and inconsistencies.

options.label: D

options.label: C

options.label: A
